discussion.content: ABCD are correct, data can be loaded into snowflake table from internal stage using bulk copying.

comments.content: well its hard to say its not valid but logically better not to use it this way ?

All are valid but the question said "valid approaches" so as approach and not as spot operation, i think that the "The Snowflake Web Interface (UI) data loading wizard" is not a valid approach.
Do you agree with me?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
All are correct
All are correct options to load data.

Selected Answer: ABD
The valid approaches to loading data into a Snowflake table are:

A. Bulk copy from an External Stage
B. Continuous load using Snowpipe REST API
D. Bulk copy from an Internal Stage

Therefore, the correct options are:

A. Bulk copy from an External Stage
B. Continuous load using Snowpipe REST API
D. Bulk copy from an Internal Stage

bulk loading from internal stage is also possible. A B C D all are correct and supprted by snowflake
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-local-file-system

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC are correct

Selected Answer: ABC
All are correct.

ABCD.
All options are correct. The Snowflake Web Interface (UI) data loading wizard is allowed for small amounts of data

Selected Answer: BCD
Why can't I select all the options? ABCD are corrrect.

Selected Answer: ABD
All are correct. Web Interface is limited to 50MB, so if you can chose only three ABD is my vote

Selected Answer: ABC
All are correct
The correct answer is ABD for valid approaches to loading data . Web UI cannot support more than 50 MB.
All should be correct depending on the situation

questions.question_text: Which of the following are valid approaches to loading data into a Snowflake table? (Choose all that apply.)

choices.D: Bulk copy from an Internal Stage
choices.C: The Snowflake Web Interface (UI) data loading wizard
choices.B: Continuous load using Snowpipe REST API
choices.A: Bulk copy from an External Stage

questions.question_text: What is the effect of configuring a virtual warehouse auto-suspend value to ‘0’?

choices.D: All clusters in the multi-cluster warehouse will resume immediately.
choices.B: The warehouse will suspend immediately upon work completion.
choices.C: The warehouse will not resume automatically.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A correct - Valid values

 Any integer 0 or greater, or NULL:

 Setting a value less than 60 is allowed, but might not result in the desired/expected behavior because the background process that suspends a warehouse runs approximately every 60 seconds and, therefore, is not intended for enabling exact control over warehouse suspension.

 Setting a 0 or NULL value means the warehouse never suspends.
